Violation/Issue description: Violation Detected: Several S3 buckets in the AWS account do not comply with security baseline requirements.
Issues identified: Server-side encryption is disabled or misconfigured.
Public access is not fully blocked.
Versioning is not enabled on S3 buckets.
Compliance references: S3 Public Access Restriction Policy (Confluence Link)
Required actions: Enable AES256 or KMS encryption on all listed buckets.
Block all forms of public access at the bucket level.
Enable Versioning on the impacted buckets.
If Terraform exists for the buckets, generate a remediation patch adjusting module variables or resources accordingly.
Automation requirements: Identify whether bucket is managed via Terraform.
If yes: Generate PR with module updates.
If no: Provide instructions for manual remediation.
Approval requirements: Yes — Create Pull Request for review.
